kickstart.description:
SSH Config for compute nodes and other non-frontend appliances.
We are using one key pair among all SSH servers in the cluster. This implies we do not care about Man-in-the-Middle attacks. We have subverted the protection for these attacks for several releases (broadcastSSH).
This logic should not be in the ssh.xml node so the frontend will generate its own keypair.

kickstart.post:
RSAKEY=/etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key DSAKEY=/etc/ssh/ssh_host_dsa_key for file in ${RSAKEY}* ${DSAKEY}*; do if [ -f $file ]; then /bin/rm -f $file fi done
/usr/bin/ssh-keygen -t rsa -N '' -f $RSAKEY /usr/bin/ssh-keygen -t dsa -N '' -f $DSAKEY
for file in ${RSAKEY} ${DSAKEY}; do chmod 0400 $file chmod 0444 ${file}.pub done
